fields.label: Starting letters
fields.description: Enter the prefix letters for your receipt numbers (e.g., 'INV' for INV00001)

fields.label: Branch
fields.description: Select the branch this printing roll belongs to

fields.label: Show Number
fields.description: Shows the number of digits in the current receipt number

fields.label: Description
fields.description: Optional: Add any notes about this printing roll

fields.label: Active
fields.description: Check to make this the active roll for the branch. Only one roll can be active per branch.

fields.label: Last Printed Number
fields.description: System maintained: Shows the last used number in this roll

fields.label: Start Count
fields.description: Enter the starting number for this roll (e.g., 1 for first receipt)

fields.label: End Count
fields.description: Enter the last number for this roll (e.g., 99999)

fields.label: Add Zeros
fields.description: Number of leading zeros to add (e.g., 5 for 00001)

fields.label: Help Guide
fields.options:
How to Set Up a New Printing Roll

  1. Branch Selection:
    • First, select the branch this printing roll will be used for
    • Each branch can have multiple rolls, but only one can be active at a time
  2. Receipt Number Format:
    • Starting Letters: Add a prefix (e.g., 'INV' for INV00001)
    • Add Zeros: Specify how many leading zeros (e.g., 5 for 00001)
    • Start Count: The first number in the sequence
    • End Count: The last number in the sequence
  3. Activation:
    • Check 'Active' to make this the current roll for the branch
    • The system will automatically deactivate any other active roll for the same branch
  4. Important Notes:
    • Each sequence must be unique across all rolls
    • End Count must be greater than Start Count
    • The roll will automatically be used in Teller Invoice and Purchase when an employee from the branch starts their shift

Example Setup:
Starting Letters: INV
Add Zeros: 5
Start Count: 1
End Count: 99999
Result: INV00001, INV00002, etc.
